channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Rubbish on footpath causing an obstruction, 10th December
item.description:
Rubbish is left on the pavement and buggies and wheelchairs cannot get past without going into the road. The bins are left open and cardboard boxes are just thrown on the ground. This is a weekly occurrence.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): School Road, Chislehurst, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Sign bent over, 10th December
item.description:
A “zone ends” sign has been damaged and bent over at the junction of Suffield and Seven Sisters Roads

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Suffield Road, West Green, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken divan dumped, 10th December
item.description:
For about three weeks this broken divan has been in front of number 10 Burwash Road

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Burwash Road, Plumstead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping, 10th December
item.description:
Previous report has been marked "fixed" by Southwark but waste is still there

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Peckham, Greater London

item.title: More bed bases dumped, 10th December
item.description:
Bed bases dumped outside the garage next to 1 Burwash Road.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Burwash Road, Plumstead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overflowing litter, 10th December
item.description:
There is an extraordinarily large amount of litter and rubbish around this bin flowing into the surrounding park and trees - it’s quite disgusting. Can this be cleared up ASAP. This bin is constantly being targeted by foxes and either needs replacing with something that is a better deterrent or the council / ID Verde do a better job of managing and cleaning the bins out - do what the public is actually paying them to do

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gresham Road, Elmers End, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter alongside Platform 1 at Clapham Junction, 10th December
item.description:
Lots of litter accumulating alongside Platfrom 1 at Clapham Junction again. The photos don’t do it justice. Litter attracts litter, commuters see the litter and add to it rather than using the provided bin bags.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Prested Road, Clapham Junction, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Leaves and Rubbish, 10th December
item.description:
Leaves and rubbish behind the two planters at the junction of Hayes Road and Westmoreland Road. Please sweep and clear.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hayes Road, Shortlands, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large potholes, 10th December
item.description:
2 large potholes located at the bus stop in northbound carriageway.

item.title: Blocking footway, 10th December

item.title: Litter along paths and roads, 10th December
item.description:
Possibly due to recent bad weather, there is a lot more litter/rubbish/debris along this stretch of pavement and road. Can this all please be cleared up? Thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kendall Road, Elmers End, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Manhole cover started being very noisy. Possible damage, 10th December
item.description:
This cover has suddenly starter becoming very noisy when run over by cars, suggesting it may have become cracked or damaged. Poses a risk to drivers. And causing very loud noise for surrounding residents.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Essex Road, Islington, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Milman rd between Harvest and Kempe, 10th December
item.description:
There has been leaves and little outside this part of Milam Rd for weeks now. Please can you come and remove it.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Milman Road, London

item.title: Residents at Adam House, 10th December
item.description:

Someone last night has come and put a mattress by the tree

item.title: Abandoned untaxed vehicle, 10th December
item.description:
Silver Jaguar as in photo has been left. It has a flat tyre and some front end damage. Parking is at a premium in this small residential street as it is there is an office block on one side and close to a railway station

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Studland Road, Penge, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bike chained to disability rail, 10th December
item.description:
Bike has previously been issued with a 7 day removal notice at this location - it’s a disability rail intended to support disabled residents and not a bike rack. Can this please be removed - considering the previous, ignored, warning

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Smalley Close, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
